text.p: We continue to look at the region under the graph of [mathjaxinline]f(x) = x-x^3[/mathjaxinline], between [mathjaxinline]x=0[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]x=1[/mathjaxinline], but now we rotate it around the line [mathjaxinline]x=1[/mathjaxinline]. The rectangle shown will rotate to form a cylindrical shell.
What will the height of the shell be?
What will the radius of the shell be?

font.p: The height is the same as the height of the rectangle, so [mathjaxinline]x-x^3[/mathjaxinline].

The radius is the horizontal distance from the rectangle to the axis of rotation. The axis of rotation is at [mathjaxinline]x=1[/mathjaxinline], and the rectangle has horizontal coordinate [mathjaxinline]x[/mathjaxinline], so the distance is [mathjaxinline]1-x[/mathjaxinline].
